channel.title: proxychains + Tor and whonix (adding new comparison)
channel.description:
maybe we can add the last table of the comparison with proxychains.
i know it is not easy job to do and add new table or to renew it. but @patrick if u can give/show which tools/methods u did use to check every attack in the comparison table maybe i can figure out and try to find time for it in the soon time to re-check the attacks again.
to read about proxychains (it is kinda like [corridor](https://github.com/rustybird/corridor/))
[ProxyChains 3.1](http://proxychains.sourceforge.net/)
[ProxyChains 4.10](https://github.com/rofl0r/proxychains-ng)
[ProxyChains 4.2.0](https://github.com/haad/proxychains)

item.title: proxychains + Tor and whonix (adding new comparison)

item.description:
No, because for most stuff, it would just say “no”.

item.title: proxychains + Tor and whonix (adding new comparison)
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
yeah it is proxifier except proxychains for unix like.

thought they are like corridor , except with small differences.

so u think non of these worth to compare with ?

en.wikipedia.org

Comparison of proxifiers

A proxifier is a software program which can make other programs pass through a proxy server by intercepting and modifying their network requests. This article compares a selection of popular proxifiers. The operating systems or virtual machines the proxifiers are designed to run on.

Read full topic
item.source: proxychains + Tor and whonix (adding new comparison)

item.title: proxychains + Tor and whonix (adding new comparison)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
proxychains is a proxifier. More similar to torsocks. Very different from corridor. It doesn’t make sense to add it to https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Comparison_with_Others. They main disadvantage of proxifier tools is, that they either work, or leak. And it is difficult to make sure, that there are no leaks.

There is some more information on proxy chains here:

Whonix

Comparison Of Tor with CGI Proxies, Proxy Chains, and VPN Services

Comparison of different Anonymizer Technologies, Anonymity Networks

Read full topic
item.source: proxychains + Tor and whonix (adding new comparison)
